definitions.definition: One of the turns of a winding, crooked, or involved course.
examples: the meanders of an old river, or of the veins and arteries in the body

definitions.definition: One of a series of regular sinuous curves, bends, loops, turns, or windings in the channel of a river, stream, or other watercourse
Synonym of Greek key , a decorative border ; fretwork .
A self-avoiding closed curve which intersects a line a number of times.
A path on which the directions, distances, and elevations are noted, as a part of a land survey .
A decorative border consisting of a repeated linear motif , particularly of intersecting perpendicular lines.

main_definition: ( often plural ) One of the turns of a winding, crooked, or involved course.
secondary_definitions: ( geography ) One of a series of regular sinuous curves, bends, loops, turns, or windings in the channel of a river, stream, or other watercourse
Synonym of Greek key , a decorative border ; fretwork .
( mathematics ) A self-avoiding closed curve which intersects a line a number of times.
( possibly obsolete ) A path on which the directions, distances, and elevations are noted, as a part of a land survey .
( architecture ) A decorative border consisting of a repeated linear motif , particularly of intersecting perpendicular lines.
